definition

Class Solution

  • java.lang.Object
    • definition.Solution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Solution>

    public class Solution
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Solution>, java.lang.Cloneable
    Representation of a solution of an schedulinging problem such as the TSP or the permutation flow shop problem.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Solution(Instance instance)
      Builds an empty solution for a specific instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Does a circular permutation of the jobs or cities at positions pos1, pos2 and pos3.

      Inserts the job at the specified position in the scheduling.
      void leftShift(int posBegin, int posEnd)
      Moves to the left every jobs/cities between beginning position and ending position, with the job that was in posBegin going in posEnd.
      void merge(Solution other)
      Adds the jobs/cities that are not in this solution, completing this scheduling in the same order than the one they appear in the other's scheduling.

      Removes the job at the specified position in the scheduling.

      Moves to the right every jobs/cities between beginning position and ending position, with the job that was in posEnd going in posBegin.

      Assigns a copy of the scheduling o to this scheduling.

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex(int job)
        Gets the index of the specific job in the scheduling. If the job is not in the scheduling, it returns -1.
        Parameters:
        job - the job
        Returns:
        the index of the job in the scheduling

      • getScore

        public double getScore()
        Gets the score of the scheduling.
        Returns:
        the score

        Gets the instance on which this solution is built.
        Returns:
        the instance

        public void evaluate()
        Computes the score of the scheduling, depending on the type of the instance.

        public java.lang.String toString()

      • insertJob

        public void insertJob(int job,
                      int pos)
        Inserts the job at the specified position in the scheduling. The sequence of previous jobs beginning at the position is first moved to the right.
        Parameters:
        job - the job
        pos - the position

      • removeJob

        public void removeJob(int pos)
        Removes the job at the specified position in the scheduling. The jobs that were after in the scheduling are moved such that the scheduling does not have a hole.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int job)
        Checks if the scheduling contains the specific job or city.
        Parameters:
        job - the job
        Returns:
        true only if the job or city is in the scheduling

      • swap

        public void swap(int pos1,
                 int pos2)
        Exchanges the jobs or cities at positions pos1 and pos2.
        Parameters:
        pos1 - the first position
        pos2 - the second position

      • change

        public void change(int pos1,
                   int pos2,
                   int pos3)
        Does a circular permutation of the jobs or cities at positions pos1, pos2 and pos3. The job/city in pos1 goes in pos2, the one in pos2 goes in pos3 and the one in pos3 goes in pos1.
        Parameters:
        pos1 - the first position
        pos2 - the second position
        pos3 - the third position

      • rightShift

        public void rightShift(int posBegin,
                       int posEnd)
        Moves to the right every jobs/cities between beginning position and ending position, with the job that was in posEnd going in posBegin.
        Parameters:
        posBegin - the beginning position
        posEnd - the ending position

      • leftShift

        public void leftShift(int posBegin,
                      int posEnd)
        Moves to the left every jobs/cities between beginning position and ending position, with the job that was in posBegin going in posEnd.
        Parameters:
        posBegin - the beginning position
        posEnd - the ending position

      • reverse

        public void reverse(int from,
                    int to)
        Reverse jobs/cities with position between from (inclusive) and to (exclusive).
        Parameters:
        from - the beginning position
        to - the ending position

      • merge

        public void merge(Solution other)
        Adds the jobs/cities that are not in this solution, completing this scheduling in the same order than the one they appear in the other's scheduling.
        Parameters:
        other - the other solution

      • copyRange

        public void copyRange(Solution other,
                      int from,
                      int to)
        Copy jobs/cities with positions between from and to. The solution should be empty in the given range when using this method.
        Parameters:
        other - the other solution
        from - the beginning position
        to - the ending position

      • generateSolution

        public static Solution generateSolution(Instance inst)
        Generates a random solution of the problem represented by the instance.
        Parameters:
        inst - the instance
        Returns:
        the solution

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Solution s)
        Checks if the two solutions are the same.
        Parameters:
        s - the solution
        Returns:
        true, if successful
